exercises.statement: A $100 \times 100$ grayscale image matrix has rank 5. How many numbers are needed to store it using SVD?
exercises.solution: SVD with rank 5: need 5 singular values, 5 columns of $U$ ($100 \times 5 = 500$ numbers), and 5 rows of $V^T$ ($5 \times 100 = 500$ numbers). Total: $5 + 500 + 500 = 1005$ numbers, vs. $100 \times 100 = 10000$ for the full matrix.

sections.sectionTitle: Bases and Matrices in the SVD

exercises.statement: What are the singular values of an orthogonal matrix $Q$?
exercises.solution: $Q^TQ = I$, so eigenvalues of $Q^TQ$ are all 1. Singular values: all equal to 1.

exercises.statement: Centered data points: $(1, 2)$, $(2, 1)$, $(-1, -2)$, $(-2, -1)$. Find the first principal component.
exercises.solution: Data matrix $X = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 1 \\ -1 & -2 \\ -2 & -1 \end{pmatrix}$. $X^TX = \begin{pmatrix} 10 & 8 \\ 8 & 10 \end{pmatrix}$. Eigenvalues: $18, 2$. First eigenvector: $(1/\sqrt{2}, 1/\sqrt{2})$. First principal component direction: $(1, 1)/\sqrt{2}$.

exercises.statement: If singular values are $\sigma_1 = 10, \sigma_2 = 1$, what fraction of variance is captured by the first principal component?
exercises.solution: Total variance $\propto \sigma_1^2 + \sigma_2^2 = 100 + 1 = 101$. First PC captures $100/101 \approx 99\%$ of the variance.

exercises.statement: The SVD shows $A$ maps the unit sphere to an ellipse. What are the semi-axes of this ellipse for $A = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 \end{pmatrix}$?
exercises.solution: Singular values: $\sigma_1 = 3$, $\sigma_2 = 2$. The unit circle maps to an ellipse with semi-axes of length 3 (along $x$-axis) and 2 (along $y$-axis).
